precaution: Air quality is good. No restrictions for outdoor activities.
Air quality is moderate. Outdoor activities are safe for most, but sensitive groups should be cautious.
Unhealthy for sensitive groups. Reduce prolonged outdoor exertion.
Unhealthy for everyone. Limit outdoor activities, use masks if necessary.
Very unhealthy. Avoid outdoor activities, stay indoors with air purifiers.
Hazardous. Strictly stay indoors, use N95 masks and air purifiers if available.
Safe to go outdoors, but carry inhaler and avoid high-traffic areas.
Air quality may trigger asthma. Limit outdoor exertion, wear a mask if needed.
Avoid outdoor activity. Stay indoors with clean air, use inhaler if symptoms occur.
Very high risk for asthma patients. Strictly stay indoors, keep inhaler nearby, avoid exposure completely.
Safe, but avoid overexertion if you feel discomfort.
Mild risk. Avoid intense outdoor activities.
Increased risk of chest discomfort or shortness of breath. Stay indoors.
Very high risk. Stay indoors, monitor heart condition, avoid exertion.
Air quality is safe. Gentle outdoor activities are fine.
Limit outdoor exposure. Prefer indoor environments.
Avoid outdoor activity. Stay indoors, stay hydrated.
High risk. Stay indoors, use purifier if possible, avoid exposure.
Safe for outdoor play. Encourage outdoor activity.
Outdoor play should be reduced. Avoid dusty areas.
Avoid outdoor play. Prefer indoor games.
Stay strictly indoors. Ensure indoor air is clean.
Safe, but monitor for any breathing issues.
Limit outdoor activity, especially walking in polluted areas.
Stay indoors as much as possible. Use masks if going out.
High risk for respiratory issues. Stay indoors, use air purifiers.
Air quality is safe, but continue medications regularly.
Mild risk of symptoms. Limit exertion, keep medications handy.
Avoid outdoor activity. Use inhalers/medication as prescribed.
Very high risk. Stay indoors, avoid pollution exposure completely.
